title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: There should be a warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty file(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to shutdown/reboot the computer.

Expected Results:
- A warning or question message box should appear to give users a chance to save their dirty file(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.

Results:
- There is no warning or question message box, and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.
- Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook, etc.) do not exhibit this behavior.
